solution_line_template: There are {cherries_per_pound} cherries in a pound and she needs {pounds_needed} pounds to make a pie so she needs {cherries_per_pound}*{pounds_needed} = <<{cherries_per_pound}*{pounds_needed}={total_cherries}>>{total_cherries} cherries

It takes her 10 minutes to pit a unit of {cherries_per_unit} cherries. She has {total_cherries}/{cherries_per_unit} = <<{total_cherries}/{cherries_per_unit}={num_units}>>{num_units} units of cherries to pit

It takes {minutes_per_unit} minutes to pit a unit of cherries and she has {num_units} units so it will take her {minutes_per_unit}*{num_units} = <<{minutes_per_unit}*{num_units}={total_minutes}>>{total_minutes} minutes

{minutes_per_hour} minutes are in 1 hour and it takes her {total_minutes} minutes so that's {total_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour} = <<{total_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour}={total_hours}>>{total_hours} hours
